name: ffprobe

options.description: show license
show help
show help
show help
show help
show version
show build configuration
show available formats
show available muxers
show available demuxers
show available devices
show available codecs
show available decoders
show available encoders
show available bit stream filters
show available protocols
show available filters
show available pixel formats
show standard channel layouts
show available audio sample formats
show available stream dispositions
show available color names
set logging level
set logging level
generate a report
set maximum size of a single allocated block
force specific cpu flags
force specific cpu count
do not show program banner
list sources of the input device
list sinks of the output device
force format
show unit of the displayed values
use SI prefixes for the displayed values
use binary prefixes for byte units
use sexagesimal format HOURS:MM:SS.MICROSECONDS for time units
prettify the format of displayed values, make it more human readable
set the output printing format (available formats are: default, compact, csv, flat, ini, json, xml)
alias for -print_format
select the specified streams
print sections structure and section information, and exit
show packets data
show packets data hash
show probing error
show format/container info
show frames info
show a set of specified entries
show log
show packets info
show programs info
show streams info
show chapters info
count the number of frames per stream
count the number of packets per stream
show ffprobe version
show library versions
show program and library versions
show pixel format descriptions
show optional fields
show private data
same as show_private_data
force bitexact output
set read intervals
read specified file
write to specified output
override the printed input filename
read and decode the streams to fill missing information with heuristics

.D..A...... Apply intensity stereo phase inversion (default true)
.D..A...... Set decoding password
.D..A...... Bits per G722 codeword (from 6 to 8) (default 8)
<boolean> .D...S..... emit subtitle events as they are decoded for real-time display (default false)
.D...S..... minimum elapsed time between emitting real-time subtitle events (from 0 to 500) (default 200)
<int> .D...S..... select data field (from -1 to 1) (default auto)
.D...S..... compute end of time using pts or timeout (default false)
.D...S..... compute clut when not available(-1) or only once (-2) or always(1) or never(0) (default auto)
.D...S..... (from -1 to 63) (default -1)
.D...S..... set the global palette
.D...S..... obtain the global palette from .IFO file
.D...S..... Only show forced subtitles (default false)
.D...S..... Frame width, usually video width (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)
.D...S..... Frame height, usually video height (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 0)
.D...S..... Set if ASS tags must be escaped (default false)
.D.V....... Select an operating point of the scalable bitstream (from 0 to 31) (default 0)
.D.V....... Set deinterlacing mode (from 0 to 2) (default weave)
.D.V....... GPU to be used for decoding
.D.V....... Maximum surfaces to be used for decoding (from 0 to INT_MAX) (default 25)
.D.V....... Drop second field when deinterlacing (default false)
.D.V....... Crop (top)x(bottom)x(left)x(right)
.D.V....... Resize (width)x(height)

version: ffprobe version 5.1.2 Copyright (c) 2007-2022 the FFmpeg developers
tldr:
> Multimedia stream analyzer.
> More information: <https://ffmpeg.org/ffprobe.html>.

- Display all available stream info for a media file:

`ffprobe -v error -show_entries {{input.mp4}}`

- Display media duration:

`ffprobe -v error -show_entries format=duration -of default=noprint_wrappers=1:nokey=1 {{input.mp4}}`

- Display the frame rate of a video:

`ffprobe -v error -select_streams v:0 -show_entries stream=avg_frame_rate -of default=noprint_wrappers=1:nokey=1 {{input.mp4}}`

- Display the width or height of a video:

`ffprobe -v error -select_streams v:0 -show_entries stream={{width|height}} -of default=noprint_wrappers=1:nokey=1 {{input.mp4}}`

- Display the average bit rate of a video:

`ffprobe -v error -select_streams v:0 -show_entries stream=bit_rate -of default=noprint_wrappers=1:nokey=1 {{input.mp4}}`
